intro: Haplopappus orcuttii, commonly known as the Orcutt's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, gray-green leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its structure includes a short stem with upright, branching growth, and it produces small, spherical seed heads that are distinctive in appearance. Haplopappus orcuttii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
